law.catch_line: An individual is not civilly liable for any act or omission while providing support to the emergency...
law.text:
An individual is not civilly liable for any act or omission while providing support to the emergency medical system by giving care, equipment, facilities, or consultation, if:
The individual is a member or employee of any federal, State, county, or city government, hospital, emergency medical service council, or agency that operates as a nonprofit group;
The act or omission is not one of gross negligence; and
The service is provided without fee to the emergency victim.
